constitutionalAuthorityStatementText:
[Congressional Record Volume 167, Number 112 (Monday, June 28, 2021)]
[House]
From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]
By Mr. DUNCAN:
H.R. 4196.
Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuant
to the following:
The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) has
overstepped its constitutional authority by issuing the order
entitled ``Temporary Halt in Residential Evictions To Prevent
the further Spread of COVID-19'' since the order does not
significantly involve interstate commerce. This legislation
attempts to restore the rights of property owners who have
been unconstitutionally impacted by the halt on residential
evictions by lifting the order and preventing its
reimplementation.
[Page H3240]

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Health.

title: Restore the Rights of Property Owners under the Eviction Moratorium Issued by the CDC Act of 2021
